STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER ROBERT GORDON
LANSING
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
September 23, 2020
Patricia Wolohan
AA Swartz Adoption Attorneys and Child Placing Agency
4371 State Street
Saginaw, MI 48603
RE: License #: CB730236853
AA Swartz Adoption Attorneys and Child Placing Agency
4371 State Street
Saginaw, MI 48603
Dear Ms. Wolohan:
Attached is the Interim Report for the above referenced facility completed on August 24,
2020. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action plan
is required. It should be noted that violations of any licensing rules are also violations of
the MISEP. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and
must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or MISEP citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, a regular license will be issued. If
you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action will result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Courtney Atkins, area manager, at (517) 599-3667.
P.O. BOX 30650  LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov  (517) 335-1980

Sincerely,
Barbara Cote, Licensing Consultant WOC
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
Suite 11
701 S. Elmwood
Traverse City, MI 49684
enclosure
2

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules
except for the following:
R 400.12605 Adoptive family evaluation.
(1) An agency social service worker shall complete a
written adoptive evaluation within 90 days of the family
signing an adoption application and prior to approving a
family for adoption.
Two of six adoption evaluations were completed in excess of 90 days from the date
of the application. One report was completed in 112 days and another was
completed in 101 days. The delays were primarily due to the applicants not
providing required documents timely. A corrective action plan is required.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that there
are additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The facility
is in compliance will all additional MISEP requirements except for the following:
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHS Contract violation. Please note that
there are additional DHHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be included
in section 1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHHS Contract/Policy
requirements except for the following:
The agency does not have a DHHS contract.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
 Criminal convictions should be discussed in the adoptive family evaluation to
show how or if the conviction would impact caring for a child.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
 The facility was not in need of consultation.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
4

period.
There were no incidents of substantiated child abuse and/or neglect during this
licensing period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
A renewal inspection was completed on 08/09/2019. There were no citations
found as part of that inspection.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon receipt of
an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility continue on a
regular license.
August 28, 2020

Barbara Cote Date
